sections.title: Prescription anti-wrinkle treatments
sections.body: Measured doses of prescription-only medicine to soften expression lines when clinically appropriate, planned by a prescriber who prioritises natural movement and safety.
bullets: Assessment of facial movement and medical history before prescribing
Conservative dosing tailored to your goals and muscle activity
Review appointments to monitor comfort and refine only when safe

sections.title: Prescriber-led treatment with transparent risks
items: Prescription issued only after a face-to-face assessment and consent discussion
Doses recorded and mapped to your facial anatomy to avoid a frozen look
Sterile technique with single-use needles and antisepsis at each site
Safety guidance on expected effects, rare adverse events, and how to contact us quickly

sections.title: We prescribe only when treatment is appropriate
sections.body: Your consultation covers muscle activity, skin quality, and medical history. We discuss whether anti-wrinkle medicine suits you, outline benefits and limitations, and agree areas such as frown lines, forehead, or crow’s feet only if safe to do so.
bullets: Full medical history, medicines, and contraindication checks
Facial mapping to balance doses and avoid brow or lid heaviness
Explanation of onset (usually several days) and duration (often up to 3–4 months)
Written aftercare and review scheduling before you leave

sections.title: For suitable patients seeking gentle softening
items: Adults with dynamic lines caused by repeated movement where muscle relaxation is appropriate
Patients wanting a measured, non-frozen finish with clear review points
Not for anyone pregnant, breastfeeding, or with contraindicated medical conditions
Those preferring prescription-led care with clear routes to reverse or pause treatment

sections.title: Consult, prescribe, treat, and review
items: Consultation: medical history, facial movement assessment, and suitability checks
Prescription & treatment: carefully placed micro-injections aligned to agreed areas
Review: follow-up (often around 2–3 weeks) to assess effect and adjust only if appropriate
Maintenance: safe intervals between appointments to avoid over-treatment
sections.strapline: Results are temporary and depend on your response. We avoid high doses or rushed top-ups to protect facial function.

sections.title: Mapped injection points for balanced results
sections.body: We plan doses per muscle group, favouring multiple micro-injections to distribute medicine evenly. Needle gauge and depth are chosen to respect underlying vessels and avoid diffusion into unintended areas.
sections.mediaHint: Prescription anti-wrinkle vials prepared with micro-needles

sections.title: Clear guidance and prompt escalation routes
items: Avoid heavy exercise, rubbing, or lying flat for the recommended period post-treatment
Mild redness, pinprick marks, or headaches can occur; bruising is possible
Rare risks like eyelid or brow heaviness are explained with advice on what to do if they appear
Direct contact details for the clinic if you have concerns between visits

faqs.question: How long do results last?
faqs.answer: Effects typically build over several days and may last up to 3–4 months, depending on your metabolism and dose.

faqs.question: Can treatment be adjusted?
faqs.answer: Yes. We schedule a review to check balance and can adjust doses only if clinically appropriate.

faqs.question: Does it hurt?
faqs.answer: Most patients report brief pinpricks. Topical anaesthetic can be provided if needed, and we use fine needles to reduce discomfort.

faqs.question: Can I combine this with other treatments?
faqs.answer: We often stage anti-wrinkle care with fillers, skin boosters, or polynucleotides when suitable. Sequencing is planned in consultation to keep safety first.

faqs.question: What if I decide not to continue?
faqs.answer: Results wear off over time. We document doses so future care can be paused or adjusted without pressure.

sections.title: Book a facial therapeutics consultation
sections.strapline: Explore whether prescription anti-wrinkle treatment is right for you with a prescriber who favours careful dosing and clear follow-up.
